goals.question: What is the distribution of wind speed?
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the frequency of different wind speeds and identify any outliers.

goals.question: What is the relationship between wind speed and direction?
goals.visualization: Scatter plot of wind speed vs. wind direction
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us identify any patterns or correlations between wind speed and direction.

goals.question: What is the average wind speed by month?
goals.visualization: Line chart of average wind speed by month
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us identify any seasonal trends in wind speed.

goals.question: What is the distribution of wind direction?
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the frequency of different wind directions and identify any outliers.

goals.question: What is the relationship between wind speed and temperature?
goals.visualization: Scatter plot of wind speed vs. temperature
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us identify any patterns or correlations between wind speed and temperature.

code:
import pandas as pd
import seaborn as sns
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.ticker as ticker

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
    sns.histplot(data=data, x='wind_speed')
    if len(plt.xticks()[0]) > 20:
        plt.gca().xaxis.set_major_locator(ticker.MaxNLocator(20))
    plt.title('What is the distribution of wind speed?', wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
chart.show()

import seaborn as sns
import matplotlib.ticker as ticker
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
    sns.scatterplot(x='wind_speed', y='wind_direction', data=data)
    if len(plt.xticks()[0]) > 20:
        plt.gca().xaxis.set_major_locator(ticker.MaxNLocator(20))
    plt.title('What is the relationship between wind speed and direction?', wrap=True)
    return plt;

data = pd.read_csv('windvectors.csv')
chart = plot(data)
chart.show()

import pandas as pd
import seaborn as sns
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.ticker as ticker

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data['date'] = pd.to_datetime(data['date'], errors='ignore')
    data['month'] = data['date'].dt.month
    monthly_avg_wind_speed = data.groupby('month')['wind_speed'].mean().reset_index()

    plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
    sns.lineplot(x='month', y='wind_speed', data=monthly_avg_wind_speed)
    
    if len(plt.xticks()[0]) > 20:
        plt.gca().xaxis.set_major_locator(ticker.MaxNLocator(20))
    
    plt.xticks(rotation=45)
    plt.title('What is the average wind speed by month?', wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
chart.show()

import pandas as pd
import seaborn as sns
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.ticker as ticker

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
    sns.histplot(data=data, x='wind_direction', bins=20)
    if len(plt.xticks()[0]) > 20:
        plt.gca().xaxis.set_major_locator(ticker.MaxNLocator(20))
    plt.title('What is the distribution of wind direction?', wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
chart.show()

import seaborn as sns
import matplotlib.ticker as ticker
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
    sns.scatterplot(data=data, x='wind_speed', y='temperature')
    plt.title('What is the relationship between wind speed and temperature?', wrap=True)
    if len(plt.xticks()[0]) > 20:
        plt.gca().xaxis.set_major_locator(ticker.MaxNLocator(20))
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
chart.show()
